item.title: Blocked Public Footpath – Forcing Pedestrians onto 50 mph Road, 10th November
item.description:
I am writing to raise an concern regarding a public footpath that is obstructed. The path’s signage has been removed, and the route has been blocked with posts and a goal, apparently by the owners of the adjacent house/farm. This obstruction forces pedestrians onto a road with a 50 mph speed limit, creating a highly dangerous situation. Public footpaths are legally protected rights of way, and walkers should always be able to use them safely, including crossing fields where the path runs. I urge the relevant authorities to take immediate action to restore safe and lawful access to this footpath. The current situation presents a serious safety risk and is inconsistent with public rights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 10th November
item.description:
Dangerous pothole eastbound on the A436 just after the old bridge. Absolutely lethal if more of the shoddily applied previous "fix" fails!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Shipton, Cotswold

item.title: Public footpath is blocked by a hedge and fence, 10th November
item.description:
The public footpath is blocked by a hedge and fence, forcing pedestrians to walk on the road around the corner, against oncoming traffic. This creates a serious safety hazard and restricts safe access for people walking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Pot hole and poor street lighting, 10th November
item.description:
Hello I am an Adult social worker for Gloucestershire County Council. I am aware that the issues I'm reporting have already been reported (ref: 8334507) however it appears the case was closed without action being taken. Could I please ask for an explanation in writing about whether the pot holes and the poor street lighting provision at the top of Belmont Road (alongside Robert Harvey / Bendall house) will be dealt with by the council? The map indicates that this road is not public? If that is the case could you clarify who is responsible for filling the pot holes and improving the street lighting? Many of the people living in Belmont house and Watson House have physical and visual impairments and there is a concern that the pot holes are increasing risk of injury, especially as the street lighting is not bright enough to highlight them to the visually impaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Winchcombe Street, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain mouth flattened causing flooding in gutter/road when raining., 10th November
item.description:
Drain outside number 3 Windermere road has been flattened. The opening for drain has been greatly reduced causing issues when raining. Flooding in gutter and out into the road from number 1 to the corner of Windermere Close. Been like this for a couple of years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
